courses_list.course_description: T﻿he Lego Explorers (K-1st) class introduces students to basic LEGO building using the LEGO 10696 kit. Please contact us to discuss kit acquisition options.

Basic Scratch Part 1 (2-3) is the first part of a two-part course introducing the Scratch platform to 2nd and 3rd graders. Scratch is a popular visual block-based programming language developed by the MIT Media Lab. No experience is necessary for this class. Students need internet access and a personal device (preferably computer).

Basic Scratch Part 2 (2-3) is the second part of a two-part course introducing the Scratch platform to 2nd and 3rd graders. Students should have taken Basic Scratch Part 1 before taking this class. Scratch is a popular visual block-based programming language developed by the MIT Media Lab. Students need internet access and a personal device (preferably computer)

S﻿nap Circuits (2-3) introduces students to the basics of electrical circuits using the Snap Circuits kit, a simple kit that enables students to build many types of circuits. Please contact us to discuss kit acquisition options.

V﻿EX GO (3-5) introduces students to robotics using the VEX GO kit, an accessible robotics kit that includes structural pieces, electronic components, and motors. Robotics for All can lend kits to schools and partner organizations that require them.

S﻿cratch (4-6) is an entry-level course introducing students to the Scratch platform, a popular block-based programming language developed by the MIT Media Lab. Students do not need prior experience with programming. Students will need an internet connection and a personal device (preferably computer).

C﻿omputer-Aided Design (CAD) with Tinkercad introduces students in 3rd-8th grades to the basics of computer-aided design using Tinkercad, a simple web-based platform. Students do not need prior experience or knowledge of CAD. Students will need internet access and a personal device (preferably computer).
